intro: Piptatherum schugnanicum, commonly known as the Schugnan grass, is a perennial grass species native to Central Asia. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and compact growth habit, typically forming dense clumps. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that contain numerous tiny grains, typical of the Poaceae family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
